documents.content:
# Head Start & Early Head Start Eligibility (2026)

## What is Head Start?

Head Start provides comprehensive developmental services for children from low-income households from birth to kindergarten entry. California operates the largest Head Start program in the nation.

## Program Types

### Early Head Start (EHS)
- **Ages:** Birth to 3 years
- **Services:** Child development, parenting support, health services
- **Settings:** Center-based, home-based, or combination

### Head Start
- **Ages:** 3-5 years (until kindergarten entry)
- **Services:** Early education, health, nutrition, family engagement
- **Settings:** Primarily center-based

## Income Eligibility

**Primary eligibility:** Family income at or below Federal Poverty Level (FPL)

### 2025 Federal Poverty Guidelines
| Family Size | Annual Income |
|-------------|---------------|
| 2 persons | $20,440 |
| 3 persons | $25,820 |
| 4 persons | $31,200 |
| 5 persons | $36,580 |

## Categorical Eligibility (Income Not Required)

- Children in foster care
- Children experiencing homelessness
- Families receiving public assistance (TANF, SSI)

## Additional Enrollment Priorities

- Children with disabilities (10% of slots reserved)
- Children whose families receive public benefits
- Children of migrant and seasonal farmworkers

## Services Included

- Free high-quality early education
- Health screenings (vision, hearing, dental)
- Nutritious meals and snacks
- Family support services
- Disability services
- Parent involvement activities

## How to Apply

1. Find your local Head Start program at eclkc.ohs.acf.hhs.gov
2. Contact program directly for application
3. Provide income verification and child's birth certificate

**No family fees** - Head Start is completely free

**Federal Resource:** https://eclkc.ohs.acf.hhs.gov/
**CA Resource:** https://rrnetwork.org/family-services/find-child-care
